content.question: Step 1: <math alttext="question mark" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="N O 3 gas plus C O gas react to produce N O 2 gas plus C O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) Overall: <math alttext="N O 2 gas plus C O gas react to produce N O gas plus C O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> A two-step reaction mechanism is proposed for a gas-phase reaction, as represented above. Which of the following correctly identifies both the chemical equation for step 1 and the rate law for the overall reaction?

choices.label: The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="2 N O 2 gas reacts to produce N O gas plus N O 3 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals the molar concentration of N O 2 squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="N O 2 gas plus C O gas react to produce N O gas plus C O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of C O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][CO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="N O 3 gas plus 2 C O gas react to produce N O gas plus 2 C O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of C O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][CO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="N O 3 gas plus N O 2 gas plus 2 C O gas react to produce N O gas plus N O 2 gas plus 2 C O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals the molar concentration of N O 3, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of C O squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>][NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>][CO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="2 N O 2 gas reacts to produce N O gas plus N O 3 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals the molar concentration of N O 2 squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
